title: The Reflexion process

definitions.Actor: produces a trajectory π0 by interacting with the environment
definitions.Evaluator: produces a score r0 which is computed as πt = Me(π0), where πt is only a scalar reward for trial t
definitions.Self-Reflection model: analyzes the set of { π0, r0 } to produce a summary sr0 which is stored in the memory mem, where sr_t is a verbal experience feedback for trial t

summary: The slide explains the Reflexion process, detailing the roles of the Actor, Evaluator, and Self-Reflection model in producing and evaluating a trajectory. The process involves the Actor interacting with the environment, the Evaluator computing a score, and the Self-Reflection model analyzing the set of trajectory and score to produce a summary. This summary is stored in memory and serves as verbal feedback for each trial.
